segment.source: StartHeapTrace
segment.target: StartHeapTrace

segment.source: StartHeapTrace
segment.target: StartHeapTrace

segment.source: StartHeapTrace
segment.target: StartHeapTrace

segment.source: Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.

segment.source: This function registers and starts a heap tracing session for a set of specified PIDs.
segment.target: This function registers and starts a heap tracing session for a set of specified PIDs.

segment.source: You can also enable stack walking for certain heap events such as allocation or deletion using this function.
segment.target: You can also enable stack walking for certain heap events such as allocation or deletion using this function.

segment.source: The process for which heap tracing is to be enabled must be created before calling this function.
segment.target: The process for which heap tracing is to be enabled must be created before calling this function.

segment.source: In order to capture heap events from the very start of the program, it is advisable that the process be started with the CREATESUSPENDED flag, then heap tracing enabled for its PID, then the process resumed.
segment.target: In order to capture heap events from the very start of the program, it is advisable that the process be started with the CREATESUSPENDED flag, then heap tracing enabled for its PID, then the process resumed.

segment.source: Heap tracing is very verbose and can quickly generate a very large trace file.
segment.target: Heap tracing is very verbose and can quickly generate a very large trace file.

segment.source: Events may be lost easily if the session’s buffers are too small or too few.
segment.target: Events may be lost easily if the session’s buffers are too small or too few.

segment.source: It is recommended that the number of processes for which heap tracing is enabled be limited in order to not lose events.
segment.target: It is recommended that the number of processes for which heap tracing is enabled be limited in order to not lose events.

segment.source: Enabling heap tracing may have a performance impact on the process being traced.
segment.target: Enabling heap tracing may have a performance impact on the process being traced.

segment.source: Parameters
segment.target: Parameters

segment.source: TraceHandle out
segment.target: TraceHandle out

segment.source: Stores a handle to an event tracing session.
segment.target: Stores a handle to an event tracing session.

segment.source: This parameter is set to zero if the handle is not valid.
segment.target: This parameter is set to zero if the handle is not valid.

segment.source: This parameter should not be compared to INVALIDHANDLEVALUE.
segment.target: This parameter should not be compared to INVALIDHANDLEVALUE.

segment.source: Do not use this handle if the function fails.
segment.target: Do not use this handle if the function fails.

segment.source: Properties in, out
segment.target: Properties in, out

segment.source: Stores a pointer to an EVENTTRACEPROPERTIES structure.
segment.target: Stores a pointer to an EVENTTRACEPROPERTIES structure.

segment.source: EVENTTRACEPROPERTIES configures certain aspects of session behavior.
segment.target: EVENTTRACEPROPERTIES configures certain aspects of session behavior.

segment.source: It is not necessary to set the Guid member because this function always uses the its own value.
segment.target: It is not necessary to set the Guid member because this function always uses the its own value.

segment.source: If you do specify a GUID it will not be used.
segment.target: If you do specify a GUID it will not be used.

segment.source: wszSessionName in
segment.target: wszSessionName in

segment.source: SThe session name to pass to StartTrace.
segment.target: SThe session name to pass to StartTrace.

segment.source: Pids in
segment.target: Pids in

segment.source: An array of process IDs to enable heap tracing on.
segment.target: An array of process IDs to enable heap tracing on.

segment.source: cPids in
segment.target: cPids in

segment.source: The size of the Pids array.
segment.target: The size of the Pids array.

segment.source: cStackTracingEventIds in
segment.target: cStackTracingEventIds in

segment.source: The size of the StackTracingEventIds array.
segment.target: The size of the StackTracingEventIds array.

segment.source: Return Value
segment.target: Return Value

segment.source: ERRORSUCCESS indicates success.
segment.target: ERRORSUCCESS indicates success.

segment.source: Possible error values are described in the following table.
segment.target: Possible error values are described in the following table.

segment.source: Error Value
segment.target: Error Value

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: ERROR_ALREADY_EXISTS
segment.target: ERROR_ALREADY_EXISTS

segment.source: Only a single instance of the kernel logger runs on the system.
segment.target: Only a single instance of the kernel logger runs on the system.

segment.source: If this function attempts to start after another component has started kernel logging, this error is possibly returned.
segment.target: If this function attempts to start after another component has started kernel logging, this error is possibly returned.

segment.source: ERROR_INVALID_FLAGS
segment.target: ERROR_INVALID_FLAGS

segment.source: Possibly indicates that there are invalid trace flags in Properties.EnableFlags.
segment.target: Possibly indicates that there are invalid trace flags in Properties.EnableFlags.

segment.source: ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY
segment.target: ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY

segment.source: Possibly indicates failure to allocate memory for EVENT_TRACE_PROPERTIES.
segment.target: Possibly indicates failure to allocate memory for EVENT_TRACE_PROPERTIES.

segment.source: If the function fails for a reason other than those listed, a system error code is returned.
segment.target: If the function fails for a reason other than those listed, a system error code is returned.

segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: None
segment.target: None
